decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 22-025-E01, 22-025-E02,  22-025-E03,  22-025-E04,  22-025-E05,  22-025-E06, 22-025-E07,  22-025-E08,  22-025-E09,  22-025-E10,  22-025-E11,  22-025-E12, 22-025-P01, 22-025-P02, 22-025-P03, 22-025-P04, 22-025-P05 Rev A, 22-025-P06, 22-025-P07, 22-025-P08, 22-025-P09, 22-025-P10,    22-025-P11, 22-025-P12, Hard Landscape Plan GOR-epd-ELS-XX-DR-L-0002 Rev PL04, Soft Landscape & Management Plan GOR-epd-ELS-XX-DR-L-0001 Rev PL04, Preliminary Ecological Appraisal by epd (June 2024)

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4 and 7B; London Plan (2021) policy D3; and National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The refuse storage areas shown on the approved plans shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained unobstructed in perpetuity.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy SI7 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The cycle storage areas shown on the approved plans shall provide at least 13 long stay cycle parking spaces and 2 visitor cycle spaces in accordance with London Plan standards and these shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate bicycle storage provision and in the interests of reducing congestion to the local transport network, in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) and 3.1(i) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The amenity areas for the flats shown on the approved plans shall be laid out prior to first occupation of any of the dwellings hereby permitted and retained in perpetuity thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision of amenity space within the site in accordance with London Plan Policy D6 and Policy 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Prior to commencement of the development (excluding demolition and ground works), a noise assessment report shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise sources including transport/ industrial/ commercial/ cultural uses and their noise levels occurring at the site during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays, including the aircraft noise data in Section 6, SPG10 (worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour (57dB). Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise). Details of internal noise levels according to BS8233:2014 shall be provided, together with best practicable mitigation measures, as necessary, to achieve the criteria for external amenity spaces. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Prior to commencement of the development (excluding demolition and ground works), details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 5dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedroom below/adjoining kitchen/living/dining/bathroom and circulation space of separate flat and of at least 10dB enhancement for bedrooms adjoining the communal main entrance and staircase to upper flats. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works in case of emergencies or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to first occupation of the dwellings hereby approved the 1.7m privacy screens to balconies shall be implemented and thereafter permanently retained and maintained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Prior to first occupation of the flats hereby approved the recommendations in the Preliminary Ecological Appraisal by epd (June 2024) shall be fully implemented.

Reason: To support ecology in accordance with Section 15 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), policy G6 of the London Plan (2021), policy 5.11 of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy 5.4 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | The lower half of windows at ground floor level on the eastern elevation of the development shall contain obscured glazing as indicated on the approved plans and these windows shall be retained as such permanently thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of the development in accordance with Policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); Policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The car parking spaces hereby approved shall be fully marked out and the provision of two electric vehicle charging points spaces shall be made the prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, and these car parking spaces together with the associated access and internal carriageway shall be kept continuously available for the satisfactory operation of the parking area and shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: To reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to improve local air quality in the interests of health in accordance with policies T6, SI1 and SI2 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f), 1.1(j) and 1.2(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
description: Conversion of a residential building containing five self-contained flats into seven self-contained flats (2 x one bedroom, 4 x two bedroom & 1 x three bedroom); part single, part two and part three storey side/rear extensions; alterations to roof profile of existing two storey rear outrigger and associated external alterations; private and communal amenity space, provision for cycle and refuse storage.
